Try to connect a dstore daemon connection to a remote host where the daemon is not running. The error message shown is:

    Failed to connect to the daemon on PARSER using port 4075 with an 
    unexpected exception

It would be much more user friendly to see a mesage like this instead:

    Failed to connect to the daemon on PARSER using port 4075. Please
    check if the RSE dstore daemon is running on the remote host,
    and the host is accessible through the network.

Pressing the "Details" button shows a traceback like the following; I think that at least in case of a "ConnectException: Connection refused: connect" this details exception should not be shown to the user, in favor of an improved error message as mentioned above.

For me, the Exception is:
java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused: connect

	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method)
	[...]
	at org.eclipse.dstore.core.client.ClientConnection.connectDaemon(ClientConnection.java:739)

	at org.eclipse.dstore.core.client.ClientConnection.launchServer(ClientConnection.java:642)

	at org.eclipse.rse.connectorservice.dstore.DStoreConnectorService.launchServer(DStoreConnectorService.java:1206)

	at org.eclipse.rse.connectorservice.dstore.DStoreConnectorService.launchServer(DStoreConnectorService.java:1196)

	at org.eclipse.rse.connectorservice.dstore.DStoreConnectorService.internalConnect(DStoreConnectorService.java:621)
Assigning to Future since NLS is involved
